intro: Sphaeralcea pedatifida, commonly known as the fringed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves with a distinctive lobed or fringed appearance. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sphaeralcea pedatifida is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
